详细内容:
英语A

课程编码：15MGB001H 英文名称：MS English Program 课时：36 学分：3.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院各学科、各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设的公共必修课，以《非英语专业研究生英语（第一外语）教学大纲》（试行稿）基础英语的词汇、语法、读、写、译、听、说的各项指标为评价目标。本课程旨在通过英语读写和英语听说的教授和训练，使学生在英语综合水平及交际能力方面有进一步的提高，以适应本专业科研进步和发展的需要。

预修课程

教材
刘彬等，《轻松听、轻松说》（下册）（LISTENING & SPEAKING WITH EASE），2008年

主要内容
第一部分 英语读写
1．速读
120篇一般性难度的百科类短文。课堂计时阅读。要求读速达到每分钟100-120词，读后能理解中心思想及主要内容。
2．写作与翻译
掌握基本写作技能（如文章结构，段落展开和起承转合等）；能按照要求在1小时内写出300词左右的短文（如各类说明文，论说文，文章摘要和常用应用文等），能正确表达思想，语意连贯，无重大语言错误。
训练学生并使之能将有相当难度的一般性题材英语短文译成汉语，理解正确，译文达意，笔译速度达到每小时350左右英文词；将一般难度的汉语短文译成英语，无重大语言错误，笔译速度达到每小时250左右汉字。
教材：
连先等，《英语速读》（第二册），科学出版社，北京，2001年
教学方式：班级人数以36人为限，借助多媒体进行课堂讲授、讨论及布置课下作业。
第二部分 英语听说
1．听
训练学生并使之对题材熟悉、难度不大、基本上没有生词、语速为每分钟120词的听力材料，一遍可以听懂，理解中心思想和主要内容。
2．说
训练能进行简单的日常对话。稍加准备，能就所讨论的问题进行1-2分钟的连续发言，基本清楚地表达思想。

课程编码：15MGB001H 英文名称：MS English Program 课时：72 学分：3.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院各学科、各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设的公共必修课，以《非英语专业研究生英语（第一外语）教学大纲》（试行稿）基础英语的词汇、语法、读、写、译、听、说的各项指标为评价目标。本课程旨在通过英语读写和英语听说的教授和训练，使学生在英语综合水平及交际能力方面有进一步的提高，以适应本专业科研进步和发展的需要。

预修课程

教材
1．龚立等，《硕/博英语精读》（第一册），科学出版社，北京，2000年
2．连先等，《英语速读》（第一册），科学出版社，北京，2001年
3．连先等，《英语速读》（第二册），科学出版社，北京，2003年

4．姜文东等，《发展多方阅读》，北京理工大学出版社，北京，2008年
5．张文芝等，《轻松听 轻松说》（上册），北京理工大学出版社，北京，2006年
6．张文芝等，《轻松听 轻松说》（下册），北京理工大学出版社，北京，2008年

主要内容
内容提要：
第一部分 英语读写
1．速读
结合阅读技巧的讲解，完成120篇一般性难度的百科类短文。要求读速达到每分钟100-120词，读后能理解中心思想及主要内容。
2．精读
学习3--4篇在语言及内容上都具有相当难度的课文，结合做各种词汇和内容理解类的练习，使学生学习掌握并运用各项阅读技巧 （如概括中心思想、猜词悟义、预见、推理和推论等），提高语篇层次上的阅读理解能力。
3．写作与翻译
掌握基本写作技能（如文章结构，段落展开和起承转合等）；能按照要求在1小时内写出300词左右的短文（如说明文、论说文，文章摘要等），能正确表达思想，语意连贯，无重大语言错误。训练学生并使之能将有相当难度的一般性题材英语短文译成汉语，理解正确，译文达意，笔译速度达到每小时260左右英文词；将一般难度的汉语短文译成英语，无重大语言错误，笔译速度达到每小时160左右汉字。

第二部分 英语听说
1．听
使学生能够对题材熟悉、难度不大、基本上没有生词、语速为每分钟120词的听力材料一遍可以听懂，理解中心思想和主要内容。
2．说
训练学生进行常用日常对话。稍加准备，能就所讨论的问题进行1-2分钟的连续发言，基本清楚地表达思想。

法语（中级）

课程编码：15MGB006H 英文名称：French for Advanced Learners 课时：48 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：张旭

教学目的要求
本课程是为我校有一定法语基础的学生开设的法语二外必修课。要求学生至少学习过《简明法语教程》1-18课或同等水平。通过本课程学习，要求学生在原有的法语基础上继续掌握约1000个中级词汇的用法，熟练掌握和运用法语中级语法知识。能够较好地完成日常生活中的各项交际需求、能够形成一定的法语基础应对大学法语四级或TCF/TEF考试。

预修课程

教材
《简明法语教程》上、下两册，孙辉，有光盘

主要内容
《简法》19-35课
1. 简要复习：初级课程1-18课重要基础知识点（语音、介词、固定表达法），复习阶段最多不超过6课时。
2. 时态：上册所有基本语法和下册重要几个语法点（未完成过去时、简单将来时、过去将来时、简单过去时、愈过去时）
3. 词法：关系代词、副动词、现在分词、复合疑问代词、复合关系代词、介词等。
4. 句法：时间、比较、假设、条件、目的、对立、原因、后果等。
5. 其它：信件和CV撰写、法国及法语国家社会文化知识、法国留学等文化常识。
6. 语式：条件式（现在时）、虚拟式

参考文献
《Reflets走遍法国 》，Hachette.主要为听力教材、学习法国文化用
《studio 60》，Didier，用于辅助讲解
《Taxi》，Hachette,用于辅助讲解
《Tout va bien》，Clé international，用于辅助讲解
《Connexion》，Didier，用于辅助讲解

课程教师信息

口译技能训练

课程编码：15MGX001H-01 英文名称：Interpretation Skills 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：彭宇

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院招收的各学科、各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设的公共选修课。本课程旨在通过不同专题的口译训练，帮助学生掌握基本的口译技巧，提高学生使用英语的实际能力。

预修课程

教材
一． 实用英语口译教程
二． 现场汉英口译技巧与评析
三． 实用口译手册
四． The Translator’s Guide to Chinglish

主要内容
第一部分为基本技巧部分，着重介绍口译笔记、数字口译和习语口译的方法，配有大量相关练习。
第二部分为专题部分，着重介绍外事接待、观光旅游、教育、文化、体育、科技等专题。每个专题一般由背景知识、表达法、口译练习、实用知识等几个组成部分。背景知识主要介绍中国在有关方面的现状，目的在于帮助学员掌握有关话题的基本情况，增加感性认识，培养学员做译前准备的意识和习惯；表达法部分旨在帮助学员增加词汇量，熟悉有关表达；口译练习是本课程的核心内容，目的是通过较系统的口译训练，逐渐掌握连续翻译的能力，同时熟悉有关话题的热点问题、常用词句等；实用知识部分着重介绍外事工作者经常用到的一些百科知识，拓宽学员的知识面。

英文名称: Academic Writing in English - Basic Course
详细内容:
基础学术论文写作

课程编码：15MGX004H-01 英文名称：Academic Writing in English - Basic Course 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：Torsten Juelich

教学目的要求
This course will introduce students to the fundamental principles of good academic writing. Our teaching team will use a combination of classic instructive learning and innovative teaching methods, including flipped classroom, in-class group work and peer-reviewing to foster an active approach to learning. The aim of this course is to encourage students to read, write and think in English, with particular focus on problem-solution structures commonly found in the academic literature.
By the end of this course, all students will have a clearidea of the fundamental elements of academic writing, enabling students to continuously improve their analytical thinking skills beyond the timeframe of this course.
Working knowledge of oral and written English is assumed. Active participation throughout the course will be fostered through a participation-based scoring system. The anticipated minimum ratio of in-class hours to homework time will be approx. 1:2.

预修课程

教材
Academic Writing for Graduate Students: Essential Tasks and Skills.John M. Swales and Christine B. Feak (University of Michigan Press ELT; 3rd edition)

主要内容
第一周 Introduction
第二周 Critical Thinking through Writing - Basics
第三周 Writing Exercises
第四周 Academic Writing - Audience and Purpose
第五周 Writing Exercises
第六周 Academic Writing - Style
第七周 Writing Exercises
第八周 Academic Writing - Flow
第九周 Writing Exercises
第十周 Academic Writing -- Organization
第十一周 Writing Exercises
第十二周 Organization of a Scientific Manuscript Part 1
第十三周 Writing Exercises
第十四周 Organization of a Scientific Manuscript Part 2
第十五周 Writing Exercises
第十六周 Research Ethics - Plagiarism and Scientific misconduct

参考文献

课程教师信息
Torsten Juelich, 澳大利亚国立大学（Australian National University）医学科学（分子及细胞生物学）博士，免疫学研究博士后。2009-2012在澳大利亚国立大学生物化学和分子生物学院教授本科生《Gene Expression and Regulation》课程。
2012年来华后，Juelich 博士从事英文学术论文编辑工作至今。他与中国科学院生物物理所等多个实验室建立了稳定的合作关系，并协助京外多所大学、研究机构及医院成功发表学术成果。至今，他已完成共计30余个研究小组的300余篇科研论文的合作撰写与编辑，其中多篇已发表在Science, Nature和Cell等顶级期刊上。
2014年起，Juelich博士受聘于北京大学环境与工程学院，开设《Academic Writing in English》课程；2015年起同时在中科院大学生命科学学院开设英文科技写作硕士课程。2016年春季，他还应邀在中科院计算技术研究所讲授为期6周的英文论文写作培训。

范逸洲，北京大学教育学院博士研究生，主要研究方向为MOOC、教师培训和教学设计。参与设计、开发的《翻转课堂教学法》等MOOC课程，惠及全国近二十万人次的教师学员。近三年，参与教育部科技司、国家自然科学基金课题、IDRC课题等十余项，发表英文论文五篇。

汉英翻译

课程编码：15MGX011H-01 英文名称：Chinese-English Translation Techniques 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：李晓棣

教学目的要求
本课程是为免修或已经通过硕士学位英语课程的学生进一步提高汉英翻译能力而开设的，旨在使学生更深入地了解汉语和英语两种语言的差异和因该差异而造成的汉英翻译过程中的难点，学习和掌握处理各类难点的方法和技巧。通过本课程的学习和实践，希望学生能对自己的汉英翻译能力更加自信，能更有意识地在今后的工作实践中不断提高，以适应本专业科技交流的需要。

预修课程

教材
1．教材：汉英翻译讲义（李晓棣编）
2．主要参考书：英汉、汉英词典

主要内容

课程编码：161MX001Z 英文名称：Hydrology, Freshwater Ecology and Biogeochemistry 课时：200 学分：8.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：宋献方等

教学目的要求
The objectives of the course are:
1. To learn how the hydrological cycle is working and of what components it consists, to learn physical hydrological equations and how measurements and sensors are relevant in modeling approaches used to estimate components in the hydrological cycle
2. To learn how freshwater systems function in respect to biological, physical and chemical aspects, to get insight in how microbial loops are part of freshwater systems, and to understand freshwater systems are affected by human impact and catchments
3. To learn how elements distribute between the different spheres, to get an overview of which biogeochemical processes govern distribution, transfers and transformations of the elements, to describe the interactions between the cycles of the different most important elements in different ecosystems, and to learn how human activities perturb the biogeochemical cycles at a global scale

预修课程

教材
1. George M. Hornberger, Patricia L. Wiberg , Jeffrey P. Raffensperger and Paolo D’Odorico (2014). Elements of Physical Hydrology, 2nd edition. John Hopkins University Press. ISBN-13: 978-1421413730 (the recommended text book)
Other useful books:
2. Elizabeth M. Shaw, Keith J. Beven, Nick A. Chappell, Rob Lamb (2011): Hydrology in Practice, Fourth Edition, Spon Press, Oxon, UK. This book is available for sale at the DTU bookshop.
3. W. Brutsaert (2005), Hydrology an Introduction, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge
4. Chow, V. T., et al. (1988), Applied Hydrology, McGraw-Hill, New York
5. Dingman, S. L. (2002), Physical Hydrology (2nd. Ed.), Prentice Hall, New Jersey
6. Fetter, C. W. (2001), Applied Hydrogeology, 4th ed., Prentice Hall, New Jersey

主要内容
The Hydrological module consists of lectures in combination with practical tutorials and assignments with real world hydrological problems. Notes, lecture slides and supporting material will be provided.
The Freshwater Ecology and the Biogeochemistry module consist of lectures in combination with colloquiums including student presentations and discussions and calculation exercises. Besides field sampling will be demonstrated and exercises will be performed to test the methodologies learned.

课程编码：161MX002Z 英文名称：Pollutants and Pollution Control 课时：200 学分：8.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：朱永官等

教学目的要求
Aim of the course is to introduce the fate and processes of the contaminants, the current status of the soil and water pollution and the techniques for the pollution control and water treatments.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
Sub-module 1 – Pollutants – fate and processes
Contents
The sub-module include the following topics:
• Pollutants and their retention in soil: Pollutant properties, soil and water characteristics, sorbent characteristics and sorption reactions, redox transformations, soil solution composition, metal speciation, hydrolysis and photodegradation, degradation kinetics
• Simple methods for equilibrium computation and QSAR estimations
• Environmental microbiology including microbial ecology, metal transformations and effects, degradation pathways and kinetics, antibiotic resistance
Teaching and Learning Methods
The teaching comprise sessions of combined lectures and theoretical exercises involving discussions, calculations and small computer-exercises.

Sub-module 2 - Pollution control and water treatment
Contents and Perspective
Page 4/7
This sub-module will provide the students with
• Understanding of processes of importance for the transformation and removal of selected pollutants from wastewater and contaminated surface water;
• Training in the use of process modelling in activated sludge systems;
• Tools to prepare conceptual designs of treatment systems capable of achieving specific treatment goals.
Teaching and Learning Methods
Lectures, process modelling exercises, preparation using reading material, student assignments done using peer-coaching groups; oral presentation (in group)

Sub-module 3 - Soil and groundwater pollution
Content and Perspective
• Sources to soil and groundwater pollution
• Transport, mixing, attenuation and degradation of pollutants in soil and groundwater
• Diffuse source (arsenic, pesticides) contamination in aquifers
• Soil and groundwater chemistry of heavy metals, creosote compounds, petroleum hydrocarbons related to contaminated sites
• In situ and ex-situ technologies for remediation of polluted soil and groundwater
Teaching and Learning Methods
Lectures, theoretical and practical exercises, hands-on tutorials on groundwater transport codes, article reading and group presentations.

课程编码：172D1004 英文名称：Climate Change, Environmental and Natural Resources Management 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：邓祥征等

教学目的要求
This course aims to provide students an outline of Earth’s Climate from billion years ago to present and near future. The course will discuss the climate changes at tectonic-scale, to orbital-scale, to deglacial, to historical and future.
The objectives of this course include:
1. Learning how climate scientists solve problems;
2. Understanding of the components of the Earth’s climate system and their feedback;
3. Familiar with the climate changes at different time scales and their causes;
4. Understanding of the role of CO2 in the climate systems;
5. Understanding of the orbital monsoon hypothesis.

预修课程

教材
Earth’s Climate: Past and Future by William F. Ruddiman

主要内容
Part I: Frame of climate science, 2 lectures in 2 weeks,
Part II: Tectonic-scale climate change, 2 lectures in 2 weeks,
Part III: Orbital-scale climate change, 2 lectures in 2 weeks,
Part IV: Deglacial climate change, 2 lectures in 2 weeks,
Part V: Historical and future climate change, 2 lectures in 2 weeks,
Part VI: Final exam.

课程编码：172D1005 英文名称：Earth System Science 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：陈方等

教学目的要求
Earth systems science views Earth as a physical system of interrelated phenomena, governed by complex processes involving the geosphere, atmosphere, hydrosphere and. biosphere. The Earth system science approach emphasizes relevant interactions of chemical, physical, biological and dynamical processes that extend over spatial scales from microns to the size of planetary orbits, and over time scales of milliseconds to billions of years. The Earth systems approach has become widely accepted as a framework posing disciplinary and interdisciplinary questions in relationship to humankind.

The aim of this class is to guide the students through a comprehensive understanding of the earth systems by adopting systematic and holistic approaches to the earth’s climate. First, interactions among the four major spheres are digested from climatologic point of view. Second, the interactions among sub-systems of the earth’s climate are tackled from energy-balance perspective. Third, the different time-scales and different spatial scales are thoroughly dealt with from geological perspectives. Finally, human forcing factors and the consequences are thoroughly investigated and future scenarios are discussed based on modeling results. The students upon completing this class are expected to be capable to conduct a sound scientific research on climate change or able to make a scientifically sound decision on environment management related issues.

预修课程

教材
Earth’s Climate: Past and Future (2nd). By William F. Ruddiman (2008), W.H. Freeman Publication, New York

主要内容
Week 1: Global Temperature and Global Precipitation (reading: chapters 1-2 of minor text)
Week 2: Air Circulation and Ocean Circulation (reading: chapters 3-4 of major text) (1st Exam)
Week 3: Long-term Climate Change and Astronomic Forcing (reading: chapters 7 & 8 of major text)
Week 4: Last Glacial Climate Changes (reading: chapters 14-16 of major text) (2nd Exam)
Week 5: Short-term Carbon Cycle and Greenhouse Effects (reading: chapter 18 of major text)
Week 6: Feedback Mechanisms and Climate Modeling (reading: chapter 9 of minor text) and Evidence and Consequences of Global Warming (reading: chapter 19 of major text) (3rd Exam)
Week 7: Social Responses to Climate Change (reading materials will be supplied)
Week 8: Students’ Presentations (i.e., 4th Exam)

参考文献

课程编码：162MX001Z 英文名称：Neurobiology 课时：120 学分：6.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：WANG JINHUI等

教学目的要求
Provide knowledge about general physiology (in relation to the central and peripheral nervous system), neuroanatomy, neurophysiology, neurotransmission, movement and sensation, complex brain functions, neuropharmacology, neuroimaging (mostly related to radioligand techniques) and neural blood flow into a neuroscience platform, which can be the foundation for other advanced master courses in neuroscience and neuroimaging.

预修课程

教材
Most of the course content is based on “Neuroscience” by Purves. However, in some of the topics a list of proposed reading is supplied (see Moodle). It is predominantly based on review articles in journals where downloading from PubMed most often is possible. Please note that some of the listed articles are additional reading for those with special interest.
General covering multiple subjects
Purves D et al (eds). Neuroscience. Sunderland: Sinauer Association. 1-759.
Principles of Human Physiology (5th edition) by Cindy Stanfield, Pearson Education Inc.
The relevant chapters are listed for each lecture. Where applicable a list of pages in the chapter that are exempt will be supplied by the lecturer (this content will not be examined)
Aspects of Brain Imaging
Zaidi H, Shidahara M. Neuroreceptor imaging (Chapter 11). In Choi I-Y, Gruetter R, eds. Neural metabolism in vivo. (Series: Lajtha A, ed. Advance in Neurobiology). Heidelberg: Springer. 2012; 4:305-29
Barrett JE, Coyle JT, Williams M. Translational Neuroscience: Applications in Psychiatry, Neurology, and Neurodevelopmental Disorders. Cambridge 2012.

主要内容
The course introduces the students to key concepts in neuroscience and neuroimaging starting by describing the physiological function of, and interactions between, the different organ systems within animals. Emphasis will be placed on the general mechanisms of physiological functions, where the course will take a comparative approach to highlight the basic principles of functions that are shared amongst all living animals. There will also be an emphasis on regulation of physiological functions and hierarchies of physiological regulation will be discussed. The course is also an introduction to the molecular and cellular components of the central nervous system (CNS), their development and organization. The course will provide an elementary overview of the structure and function of nervous system, with special emphasis on functional systems responsible for sensorymotor, autonomous, and cognitive function and their importance for major brain diseases within the fields of neurology, neurosurgery and psychiatry. Furthermore, an introduction to the different signaling pathways, electrical and receptor-neurotransmitter mediated signaling between neurons and other cells in the CNS will be given. The fundamental principles of diagnostics and treatment of major brain diseases will be discussed including knowledge about the dysfunction of the different signaling systems. Based on this knowledge, the molecular neurobiological aspects underlying different brain imaging methods will de discussed. Specifically, the basis for our understanding of the biology linked to the use of PET radio ligands, of MRS, of optical imaging, of two-photon imaging, and of hyperpolarized MR-substances. The course also describes molecular aspects of the coupling between function, flow, and metabolism. Finally, higher brain functions will be discussed.

课程编码：162MX002Z 英文名称：Fundamental Biomedical Signal Processing 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：王丽瑾

教学目的要求
The first part of this course introduces topics in linear algebra and calculus, which will be employed in the second part of the course as well as in other courses in the master study. We begin with a review of vector and matrix algebra and continue with orthogonality and eigen-decompositions. We review basic integration and differentiation techniques and introduce ordinary differential equations and constrained optimization. This part also also covers trigonometry, complex numbers and Fourier analysis.
The other part of the course covers basic topics from Digital Signal Processing and Analysis. Firstly, basic tools in Signal Processing will be introduced, e.g. discrete time signals, Shannons Sampling Theorem, convolution and FIR, IIR filters and spectra. This will be followed by an introduction to basic tools from Stochastic Signal Processing, including autocorrelation and Power Spectrum Density. The course is concluded with basic image processing methods, which are useful when analyzing neuroimaging data.
The course will make use of the MATLAB programming environment when working with the different topics in the course. Therefore, the course will include an introduction to MATLAB to provide participants a basic understanding of the MATLAB programming environment including the use of MATLAB functions, performing matrix operations, visualizing data, and perform simple scripts.

预修课程
Knowledge and some practical experience with vector- and matrix algebra, derivatives and integrals

教材

课程编码：162MX013Z 英文名称：Advanced Molecular & Systems Neurobiology 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：孙坚原等

教学目的要求
The objective of this course is to provide the student with a broad knowledge of current approaches for the study of neural function and behavior.
The student should get an understanding of information processing in synapses, neurons and microcircuits, and the experimental approaches used in analyzing the neurophysiological basis of behavior in intact animals. The student should be able to critically read and present the current literature, and discuss the function and structure of neuronal circuits in relation to animal behavior. This course provides an up-to-date knowledge of the neural basis for indirect measurements of global brain function such as PET and fMRI. As such, it provides insights useful when designing and interpreting experiments in human brain scanning studies. The AMNS course provides examples of genetics, signal processing and physiology used in the study of neural function in health and disease.

预修课程
Knowledge and understanding of basic neurobiology, physics, mathematics and signal processing, and electrophysiological and optical imaging methods, commensurate with a level at or above that which is the objective of the basic 1st. and 2nd.semester courses in neuroscience and neuroimaging.

教材
Current international original scientific papers and reviews.

主要内容
Each subject will be covered by one original paper and possibly one review in double-lessons. One or two students (working as a team) will present the original paper (15 minutes), followed by general discussion. In the second lesson a review may be presented by another student or by another pair of students (also 15 minutes presentations). Alternatively, only the original paper will be presented, and the review is expected to be read by the students in preparation. Both original papers and reviews will be used in the examination. Teachers will be from Chinese and Danish Universities affiliated with SDC. The teacher’s role is primarily to guide the presentations in class, and to provide feedback.

All students are expected to actively participate in class. The course directors will (before the start of the course) allocate published papers/reviews for the students to present. It is a prerequisite for attending the oral exam that the student has presented two papers, one of these must an individual presentation (to mimic the exam situation).

教学目的要求
The students will be introduced to the animal model systems used in neuroscience research. The techniques for genetic manipulation of transgenic animals models e.g. C. elegans, Drosophila, mice, rats, and pigs will be described together with the use of the different types of genetic models used in the study of neurological disease. Similarly, the main important toxico-/pharmacological, immunological and microsurgical models used in the study of neurological disease will be presented and their strengths and limitations discussed. For both types of models their usage in modern neuroimaging will be discussed. Gender- and age-associated will be discussed. The selection of animal model and experimental design will be discussed, just as the students will be introduced to animal ethics (3 R’s, Replacement, Reduction, Refinement) and legislative aspects of carrying out animal experimental research.

Passed NNPN and have basic knowledge of the major brain mapping techniques (structural and functional MRI, diffusion sensitive MRI, PET, EEG, MEG)

研究方法

课程编码：163MX003Z 英文名称：Research Methods 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The aim of module 3 is to give students a fundamental knowledge, understanding, and skills in scientific paradigms and methodologies (quantitative and qualitative) and their application (selection and use) when investigating scientific and practical problems.
Following the successful completion of the module the students will be able to:
1. Define and compare alternative scientific paradigms and designs
2. Define and discuss strengths and weaknesses of alternative methods for data collection and analysis.
3. Apply scientific methods in exercises and projects
4. Define and compare alternative scientific paradigms and designs
5. Define and discuss strengths and weaknesses of alternative methods for data collection and analysis.
6. Apply scientific methods in exercises and projects

预修课程

教材

主要内容
The course serves as an opportunity for the students to hone their skills in quantitative and qualitative research methods and methodological considerations in relation to conducting academic research and writing academic projects. The course connects with the meta-theoretical context for discussing and developing academic research. The central argument is that justifications of inferences and warranted assertions depend on the interconnections between research questions, theory, research design and analysis and that the coherence of these interconnections – philosophically and methodologically – are crucial in order to design and conduct research projects that create valid and reliable knowledge. In particular, the importance of the practical skills involved in carrying out research will be emphasized throughout.

The course will provide students with insights in the following main areas:
1. How to plan and carry out survey studies, interviews and ethnographic fieldwork
2. How to develop pertinent research questions which take into account theory, philosophy of science, and methodological considerations
3. How to select the most appropriate research design and match research questions with theory, philosophy of science, data collection methods and modes of analysis
4. The methodological considerations involved in case studies and comparative research

The course will focus on research design, methodology, qualitative research and quantitative research methods. The course comprises four sections. The first section consists of lectures on core issues in methodology, including the interconnections between research questions, research design, use of theory in design, analysis and inference, and ways of doing inference and warranted assertions. The three following sections concern three different core methods in social science and business studies: ethnographic methods, interview methods and survey methods. Each section will include lectures, group work, and practical exercises. The students will, in their project groups, carry out a mini project within each of the three method sections, drawing on the research question(s) and object of research set out for their First Semester Project. Within each of the three method sections, the students will, individually, write a short essay reporting on the mini project drawing on the relevant literature and lectures.

教学目的要求
The aim of the course is to provide students with insights into the relationships between government and business, such as, how governments at different levels impact on business practice, how businesses respond to and influence government policy, conflict and alignment of interests of government and businesses, and the changing role of national government in the globalization era.

主要内容

In Part 1, we introduce three different lenses or perspectives for understanding the government and business relations, i.e., the boundary, interest, and power lenses. In Part 2, we discuss two specific topics that are associated with each of the three lenses, including: state-owned enterprises (SOE), corporate social responsibility (CSR), industrial policy, governance of innovation, intellectual property right (IPR) protection, corporate strategies for influencing government policy making, and supra-national governances and their impacts on businesses. In Part 3, we organize workshops and guest speeches.

课程编码：164MX003Z 英文名称：Organizations and Management 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
Aim
The aim of this course is to give students an understanding of the dominant contemporary theories of organization and management and how organizations differ (or are alike) across nation states, cultures, and private and public sectors. The latter part of the course also gives an account of organizational processes and dynamics.
Learning objectives
On successful completion of this course, the student should be able to:
1) Define and explain key concepts and assumptions of different organization and management theories.
2) Understand and analyse the organizational and managerial challenges particular to organizations operating across cultures and sectors.
3) Understand organizational change and internal dynamics.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
The course consists of two parts. Part one introduces and explores general concepts of and approaches to organizational and management studies at an advanced level. The readings will address core issues such as the institutional environment of organizations, modes of coordination within and between organizations, organizational resources, contracting across legal and economic contexts, strategic partnerships and the power of networks.
Part two explores cross-national variations in organizational structure and political and economic institutional regimes. It then moves to analyses how organizations and management best respond to challenges of internationalization and cross-culturalism and how organizations evolve and what their internal power structures are. Finally, part two also deals with differences between public and private sector organizations and explores features of public sector organizations.
In-between the two parts of the course an intermittent workshop will be conducted with the aim of applying the theoretical tools learned in part one to contemporary China.

课程编码：165MX002Z 英文名称：Industrial Bioreaction Engineering 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The reactors used in the bio-industries are designed according to the same general principles as reactors elsewhere in the chemical industry. However, there are some quite specific characteristics of bio-reactions which require specialist treatment, e.g. the complex stoichiometry and thermodynamics. Using a quantitatively based approach, fermentation processes are analyzed with respect to scale-up and feasibility for the production of bio-based chemicals. Biochemistry, microbiology, sustainability and chemical engineering are all used to obtain a deeper insight into the complex world of bioreactions and their associated processes.

预修课程

教材
Bioreaction Engineering Principles, 3rd Edn, 2011, Jens Nielsen, John Villadsen and Gunnar Liden

主要内容
Role of fermentation in industrial manufacture of chemicals. Stoichiometry of cellular reactions, degree of reduction balances, yield coefficients and black box models. Evaluation of the feasibility of fermentation processes in an industrial context. Growth kinetics. Thermodynamics of bioreactions and heat balances. ATP balances and energetics. Scale-up and design of fermentation processes. Process evaluation project.

主要内容
A major part of chemical reactions in production processes and in gas cleaning processes takes place in multi-phase reactors, e.g. Production of pharmaceuticals, calcination of lime in the production of calcium hydroxide, production of cement, combustion of solid and liquid fuels in the production of power and heat, catalytic and non-catalytic cleaning of flue gas and catalytic production of important products in different reactors including two or more phases. The examples are homogeneous or heterogeneous catalyzed, gassolid, gas-liquid, liquid-solid and gas-liquid-solid reactions that take place in a number of different reactor types (batch fixed bed, moving bed, spray absorbers, packed towers, membrane reactors, fluidized bed reactors, entrained flow reactors etc.). The theory covering the different types of reactions and a number of the reactors is expounded together with examples. During the semester the students cooperate in teams solving practical oriented reactor design problems.

教学目的要求

预修课程

教材

主要内容
There two kind of audiences as following. The first category is the professional software developers building online large scale Web applications. The second category is the managers evaluating packaged software aimed at supporting online communities. We assume that students know how to write a computer program and debug it. We do not assume knowledge of any particular programming languages, standards, or protocols. The most concise statement of the course goal is to improve your way of thinking. Student would learn how to master the diversity and complexity in contemporary large scale Web applications. We promote the critical reading and thinking. Students are required to read and assimilate information from the readings beyond the material covered in class. Throughout the semester, papers and chapters of the texts will be read and discussed. Analytical writing and presentation are required. Students are asked to think critically and reason about information presented in the textbooks or papers. This critical evaluation requires that students offer their own understanding of the significance of what students have learned. Students should be able to present their knowledge to the public. The grade rules include two components: group project and individual work. The group project component has two parts: project prototype counts 25%, presentation counts 15%. The individual work component has three parts: final examination counts 30%, each homework counts 5%, final paper counts 15%.
We are going to discuss the following 6 topic or themes during the lecture time.
Chapter 1 Computing Thinking
What are the domain problems?
Problem solving process and paradigm
Value-Driven and Model Driven approach
Mapping from Requirement to Software Solutions
Computing Thinking and Basic Concepts

Algorithm and Abstraction

Domain knowledge: What are the major concepts in this domain under discuss?
Induction and classification: Actors, Actions, Entities, Process or Code, Information Architecture, Web usability.
Business models and domain models: Values of the enterprise / the related system / software system, who will get what benefits from the software?
Data Models

课程编码：176D1013 英文名称：Pattern Recognition and its Application 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：王亮等

教学目的要求
Pattern recognition techniques are used to automatically classify physical objects (handwritten characters, tissue samples) or abstract multidimensional patterns (n points in d dimensions) into known or possibly unknown categories. A number of commercial pattern recognition systems are available for character recognition, handwriting recognition, document classification, fingerprint classification, speech and speaker recognition, white blood cell (leukocyte) classification, military target recognition, etc. Most machine vision systems employ pattern recognition techniques to identify objects for sorting, inspection, and assembly. The design of a pattern recognition system requires the following modules: (i) sensing, (ii) feature extraction and selection, (iii) decision making and (iv) performance evaluation. The availability of networked MEMS (low cost, high performance and miniaturized) sensors have resulted in vast amount of digitized data. Need for efficient archival and retrieval of this data has fostered the development of pattern recognition algorithms in new application domains.
This course will introduce the fundamentals of pattern recognition with application examples. Techniques for analyzing multidimensional data of various types and scales along with algorithms for projection, dimensionality reduction, clustering and classification of data will be explained. The course will present various approaches to exploratory data analysis and classifier design so students can make judicious choices when confronted with real pattern recognition problems. It is important to emphasize that the design of a complete pattern recognition system for a specific application domain requires domain knowledge, which is beyond the scope of this course.

预修课程
Probability and statistics, Digital signal processing, Linear systems

教材
Duda, Hart and Stork, Pattern Classification, Second Edition, Wiley, 2001.

主要内容
The purpose of the project is to enable the students to get some hands-on experience in the design, implementation and evaluation of pattern recognition algorithms. To facilitate the completion of the project in a semester, it is advised that students work in teams of two. You are expected to evaluate different preprocessing, feature extraction, and classification approaches to achieve as high accuracy as possible on the selected classification task.
The project report should clearly explain the objective of the study, some background work on this problem, difficulty of the classification task, choice of representation, choice of classifiers, classifier combination strategies, error rate estimation, etc. For most of the classifiers, e.g., support vector machines and neural networks, software packages are available in the public domain. Feel free to use them. Emphasis of the project is to solve a practical and interesting pattern recognition problem using the tools that you have learnt in this course. It would be instructive to see how close you can come to the state-of-the-art accuracy on this database. Use the projection algorithms to display 2- and 3-dimensional representations of the multidimensional patterns.

课程编码：167MX002Z 英文名称：Analytical Biochemistry and Sample Preparation for Omics 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：娄晓敏等

教学目的要求
An Omics investigation is inevitably preceded by sample enrichment and purification based on the biochemical and/or physico-chemical properties of the group of molecules to be analysed. This purification is crucial, because an Omics experiment should only assay a defined group of molecules (e.g. DNA but not RNA); from a technical point it is important that samples do not contain impurities that can spoil instrumentation. Quite different purification concepts are required, because the groups of molecules subjected to an Omics study are highly diverse.This course will give theoretical and experimental insight into various enrichment and separation techniques employed in Omics studies, and outline the requirements for sample purification prior to the actual Omics analysis

预修课程

教材
Articles, reviews and handbooks which will be placed on Moddle during the semester.

主要内容
The theory behind methods used for separation and purification of RNA, DNA, proteins, peptides and metabolites will be covered, including methods based on affinity, hydrofobicity, polarity, charge and size:
1. Extraction and purification of proteins, RNA, DNA and metabolites from biological samples.
2. Chromatographic techniques
3. Electrophoretic techniques
4. Selective purification/enrichment for post-translational modifications
5. Labelling and quatitation in Proteomics
6. Sample preparation and data analysis in metabolomics
7. Sample preparation for lipidomics
8. Sample preparation for Genomics/Transcriptomics
9. Digestion of biomolecules
10. Interfacing chromatography with mass spectrometry

Practical laboratory work will include:
1. Reverse phase liquid chromatography
2. Gas chromatography
3. Lipid purification
4. Protein purification
5. Two-dimensional electrophoresis
6. MALDI peptide mass finger printing and MALDI MS/MS for identification; data analysis
7. Sample preparation for transcriptomics
8. Sample preparation for Genomics

英文名称: Introduction to Genomics: Types of Omics and the Generic Workflow
详细内容:
基因组学概述

课程编码：167MX003Z 英文名称：Introduction to Genomics: Types of Omics and the Generic Workflow 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：于军等

教学目的要求
The different fields in Omics, i.e. genomics, proteomics and metabolomics and the subfields of these have been developed rather independently. The course should introduce the students to the different levels of Omics including phenomenons that can be studied at the different levels, and to the use of bioinformatics tools to link the different levels. At the end of the course, the student should be able to describe clearly the generic concept for the application of Omics to a biological problem.

预修课程

教材
Selected scientific review and research papers delivered to the students via Moodle prior to the lectures.

主要内容
1. Omics: history and prospects
2. Introduction of genomics
3. Transcriptomics: from microarray to deep-sequencing
4. Introduction of Proteomics
5. Interaction studies using Omics
6. Introduction of metabolomics
7. Genomics and systematic biology
8. Bioinformatics and computational biology

课程名称: 代谢疾病宿主基因组，宏基因组和免疫系统互作
英文名称: Interactions between Host Genomics, Metagenomics and the Immune System in Metabolic Disorders
详细内容:
代谢疾病宿主基因组，宏基因组和免疫系统互作

课程编码：167MX004Z 英文名称：Interactions between Host Genomics, Metagenomics and the Immune System in Metabolic Disorders 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The course “Interaction between host genomics, metagenomics and the immune system in metabolic disorders” aims to provide a comprehensive overview as to how nutrition, the host genome, the gut microbiota – the assembly of bacteria/microorganisms living in the gut – and the immune system interact, modulate metabolism, and affect development of metabolic disorders such as obesity and type 2 diabetes and other human diseases, including cancer. Methods used for genomics and metagenomics research will be introduced. In addition, the course will provide an overview of the establishment of the innate and adaptive immune system, how the interaction between the genome of the organism and the gut microbiota regulates the development of the immune system, and how this interaction affects whole body metabolism. The influence of the different macronutrients – carbohydrates, proteins and fat – on whole body metabolism and energy balance and the extent to which this relates to the host genome and gut microbiota will be discussed.

预修课程

教材
PDFs of relevant articles will be provided ahead of the course.

主要内容
1. Introduction to basic genomics, metagenomics and immunology.
2. Introduction to nutrition and metabolism.
3. Development of obesity and obesity associated disorder (diabetes, cardiovascular disorders, hypertension, cancer).
4. Methods used for genomics and metagenomics research
5. Methods used for research on the immune system
6. Methods used for research on nutrition and metabolism.

参考文献

课程教师信息
Karsten Kristiansen, Professor, (kk@bio.ku.dk), Associate professor Susanne Brix Pedersen, Department of Systems Biology, Technical University of Denmark (sbp@bio.dtu.dk)

基础汉语听说-实验班

课程编码：17DGB016-03 英文名称：Elementary Chinese-Listening and Speaking (Experimental Class) 课时：128 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：林雪珍

教学目的要求
1.教师尽量按照规定的进度进行教学，由于一些原因，如不能按照进度上课，必须及时通知课型负责人。
2.每课需要听写的汉字，需要会认的汉字，听从课型负责人安排。
3.期中、期末比较大的两次考试，由课型负责人统一安排，各位老师共同出题完成。期中试题要在10月27日前完成，期末试题要在12月15号前完成。请各位老师配合。
4.每次考试前，请给学生进行复习。
5.每次的听写和作业要打分。10分是满分。

预修课程

教材
体验汉语 口语教程1 高等教育出版社

主要内容
1.听说课第一周主要上拼音课，并不学习课本，让学生初步掌握拼音的基本知识，同时让学生学习课堂用语。
2.从第二周开始，每4个课时完成一课的教学内容。
3.第9周星期五11月8日期中考试，第17周星期五12月27号期末考试。
4.除期中期末考试外，在第4周、第8周、第13周、第16周要进行4次小考试，具体考试在星期几由教师决定。

课程教师信息

中国概况

课程编码：17DGB017-01 英文名称：Introduction to Chinese Culture 课时：48 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：胡耀武

教学目的要求
本课程拟通过课题教学、视频、实物以及课堂互动等多种教学形式，向留学生讲述中国社会发展状况、历史文化特点、民俗、中国传统思想、当代中国现状、礼仪、科技等多方面内容，引导学生领略中国文化的内涵和精神、观览中国社会和文明独特的发展之路，理解中国社会和文化的的特点，更好地体会中华文化的魅力。通过本课程的学习，将使得留学生基本掌握中国历史和文化的发展脉络，对当前中国社会的发展现状有一定的认识和理解，加强他们对在中国学习和工作的兴趣和积极性，消除他们在异国他乡的孤独感和陌生感，促使他们能够更好、更早地融入中国社会，为今后的工作与学习奠定基础。

预修课程

教材
（1） 郭鹏、程龙、姜西良. 中国概况. 北京，高等教育出版社，2011

主要内容
第一章：引言和概论
主要讲述中国文化的概念和内涵
第二章：地理环境和中国文化
主要讲述中国的地理环境、人口、民族、疆域和行政规划以及不同地区对应不同文化特点
第三章：中国历史
分古代史、近代史、现代史三部分讲述中国历史以及不同时期中国文化的发展特点及演变过程
第四章：中国传统思想
主要讲述中国的儒家、道家、理学等中国传统思想的由来与发展
第五章：中西交流与传播
主要讲述中国文化在起源与发展过程中与外界的相互交流
第六章：独具中国文化的物质和精神表现
主要讲述文房四宝、丝绸、陶瓷、中医、书法、四大发明、戏剧、文学、茶、酒等最能体现中国文化物质和精神体现
第七章：当代中国文化
主要讲述当代中国的生活、政治制度、基本国策和社会地位等等

参考文献
（2） Guo Peng, Cheng Long. China Panarama. Beijing. Higher Education Press., 2011
（3） 莫海斌，邵长超，蔡贤榜，李卫涛。 中国概况（海外华文教育系列教材）. 广州，暨南大学出版社，2012
（4） 史仲文，陈桥生. China’s culture. 五洲传播出版社,2010
（5） 张振华. 中国文化全知道. 工人出版社, 2010
（6） 程裕祯. 中国文化要略（第三版）. 外语教学与研究出版社, 2011

教学目的要求
本课程拟通过课题教学、视频、实物以及课堂互动等多种教学形式，向留学生讲述中国社会发展状况、历史文化特点、民俗、中国传统思想、当代中国现状、礼仪、科技等多方面内容，引导学生领略中国文化的内涵和精神、观览中国社会和文明独特的发展之路，理解中国社会和文化的的特点，更好地体会中华文化的魅力。通过本课程的学习，将使得留学生基本掌握中国历史和文化的发展脉络，对当前中国社会的发展现状有一定的认识和理解，加强他们对在中国学习和工作的兴趣和积极性，消除他们在异国他乡的孤独感和陌生感，促使他们能够更好、更早地融入中国社会，为今后的工作与学习奠定基础。

预修课程

教材
（1） 郭鹏、程龙、姜西良. 中国概况. 北京，高等教育出版社，2011

主要内容
第一章：引言和概论
主要讲述中国文化的概念和内涵
第二章：地理环境和中国文化
主要讲述中国的地理环境、人口、民族、疆域和行政规划以及不同地区对应不同文化特点
第三章：中国历史
分古代史、近代史、现代史三部分讲述中国历史以及不同时期中国文化的发展特点及演变过程
第四章：中国传统思想
主要讲述中国的儒家、道家、理学等中国传统思想的由来与发展
第五章：中西交流与传播
主要讲述中国文化在起源与发展过程中与外界的相互交流
第六章：独具中国文化的物质和精神表现
主要讲述文房四宝、丝绸、陶瓷、中医、书法、四大发明、戏剧、文学、茶、酒等最能体现中国文化物质和精神体现
第七章：当代中国文化
主要讲述当代中国的生活、政治制度、基本国策和社会地位等等

参考文献
（2） Guo Peng, Cheng Long. China Panarama. Beijing. Higher Education Press., 2011
（3） 莫海斌，邵长超，蔡贤榜，李卫涛。 中国概况（海外华文教育系列教材）. 广州，暨南大学出版社，2012
（4） 史仲文，陈桥生. China’s culture. 五洲传播出版社,2010
（5） 张振华. 中国文化全知道. 工人出版社, 2010
（6） 程裕祯. 中国文化要略（第三版）. 外语教学与研究出版社, 2011

线性代数I-A

课程编码：B01GB001Y-A01 英文名称：Linear Algebra I-A 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：席南华

教学目的要求
本课程是各专业本科生必修基础课。要求学生通过本门课程的学习，掌握线性代数的入门知识和方法，还有相关的代数基本知识。本课程分A（数理）, B（理工）两类。这两类的基本内容相同（见第三部分：教学内容和学时），但B类有更多的理论分析，A类则以严格的理论证明为基础。A类适合那些以后继续学习数学、物理、计算机等学科的学生，也适合继续学习其他学科的学生，B类适合以后学习数学以外任何专业的学生。
通过本课程教学，学生应达到以下基本要求：掌握线性代数入门知识及相关的代数知识的基本概念和基本方法，初步了解和形成线性代数的思维方式，为学习线性代数II和其他课程打下基础。

预修课程
无

主要内容
一、代数的起源（约四周）
 简谈代数，线性方程初步，约三节课
 低阶行列式 约二节课
 集合与映射 约二节课
 等价关系与商映射 约二节课
 置换 约四节课
 整除 约二节课
 归纳法放入习题讨论课中

二、矩阵 （约三周）
 行和列的向量空间 约二节课
 矩阵的秩 约二节课
 线性映射，矩阵的乘法 六节课

三、行列式（约四周）
 行列式、构造和基本性质 约四节课
 行列式进一步性质 约四节课
 行列式的应用 约四节课
 行列式的公理化构造 约二节课

四、群、环、域（约三周）
 具有代数运算的集合 约二节课
 群 约四节课
 环和域 约六节课

五、 多项式(约三周)
 多项式环 约二节课
 多项式环中的因式分解 约四节课
 多项式的根 约四节课
 对称多项式 约二节课

课时分配

课程思政

教材
柯斯特利金《代数学引论》第一卷

参考文献
希洛夫：《线性空间引论》(第二版），高等教育出版社

教学目的要求
本课程是各专业本科生必修基础课。要求学生通过本门课程的学习，掌握线性代数的入门知识和方法，还有相关的代数基本知识。本课程分A（数理）, B（理工）两类。 这两类的基本内容相同（见第三部分：教学内容和学时），但B类有更多的理论分析，A类则以严格的理论证明为基础。A类适合那些以后继续学习数学、物理、计算机等学科的学生，也适合继续学习其他学科的学生，B类适合以后学习数学以外任何专业的学生。

微积分I-A

课程编码：B01GB002Y-A01 英文名称：Calculus I-A 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：张平

教学目的要求
本课程是数学类各专业最重要的基础课之一。基本内容包括极限、连续性、导数及应用、不定积分、定积分、级数、傅里叶级数、多变量函数微分学、重积分、曲线和曲面积分、含参变量的积分等。本课程是许多后继课程如微分方程、微分几何、复变函数、实变函数、概率论、基础物理、理论力学等学习的基础。微积分同时也是大学数学的基本能力及思维方法的训练重要课程。具有良好的微积分的基础对于今后的学习和研究起着关键的作用。

预修课程

主要内容
第一章 实数
1 特殊实数类以及它们的基本性质
2 戴德金分割和确界原理
3 实数完备性的若干基本引理
第二章 极限
1 数列的极限
2 收敛数列的性质
3 Cauchy 收敛原理
4 函数的极限
第三章 连续函数
1 连续函数的定义
2 连续函数的性质
3 初等函数的连续性
第四章 导数
1 导数的概念
2 求导法则
3 参变量函数的导数
4 高阶导数
第五章 微分
1 可微性与微分
2 微分学基本定理
3 微分与函数性质
4 微分在自然科学中的应用
第六章 不定积分
1 不定积分概念与基本积分公式
2 换元积分法与分部积分法
3 有理函数和可化为有理函数的不定积分
第七章 定积分
1 定积分概念
2 牛顿-莱布尼茨公式
3 可积条件
4 定积分的性质
5 微积分基本定理
6 定积分的应用
第八章 反常积分
1 反常积分概念
2 无穷积分的性质与收敛判别
3 具有奇异点的反常积分
